 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָכַל‎</span>] **verb** ==be crafty, deceitful, knavish== (Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***nakâlu, be crafty, cunning;***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְכֵל‎</span> ***be crafty***, Pa\`el ***deceive***; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***deceive, plot***; compare perhaps <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***act faithlessly***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***faithless***, [[BDB#Prä|Prä]]<sup>Amhar. Spr. 90</sup>); — 

**Qal** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוֺכֵל‎</span> [[Mal.1.14|Mal 1:14]] ***knave***. **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine plural with accusative of congnate meaning with verb <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִכְלֵיהֶם אֲשֶׁר נִכְּלוּ לָכֶם‎</span> [[Num.25.18|Num 25:18]] ***their wiles with which they beguiled you***. **Hithpa\`el** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּתְנַכְּלוּ אֹתוֺ לַהֲמִיתוֺ‎</span> [[Gen.37.18|Gen 37:18]] ***they knavishly planned*** against him ([[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>iii. 9</sup>), etc.; ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְחִתְנַכֵּל בְ‎</span> [[Ps.105.25|Ps 105:25]] ***to deal knavishly with***.
